item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Informational Presentation on the State Parks Sea Level Rise Adaptation Strategy

subitem_title: Informational Presentation on MRCA’s two new Malibu public access improvement projects

subitem_title: Application No. 1-90-210-A1 (Moat Creek Managing Agency, Pt. Arena)
subitem_blurb: Application by Moat Creek Managing Agency to amend permit originally granted for public access facilities to add ADA improvements for trail, parking, and restroom access and to authorize ongoing trail maintenance activities, at Moat Creek Beach, 27150 South Highway 1, approx. 2 miles south of Point Arena, Mendocino County. (BJ-A)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination Mitigation Program.
subitem_blurb: Review and possible Commission action on the proposed 2022-2023 Work Plan and Budget for technical oversight and independent monitoring under the Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination mitigation program required as condition of Permit No. E-06-013 (Poseidon Resources (Channelside) LP), San Diego County. (AB-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application 9-19-1242 (Tomales Bay Oyster Company, Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by Tomales Bay Oyster Company for after-the-fact authorization of approx. 33-acres of existing oyster and mussel aquaculture operations and associated activities on 160-acre lease of state water bottoms in the southwestern portion of Tomales Bay between Millerton and Tomasini points, Marin County. (AC-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Application No. 1-20-0539 (Pacific Gas & Electric Co., Arcata)
subitem_blurb: Application by PG&E to remove major vegetation along electrical lines near Arcata Sports Complex and Jacoby Creek in the City of Arcata, including follow-up authorization for emergency vegetation removal in 2020 and 2021 and 10 years of ongoing vegetation maintenance  within a project maintenance area of up to ~11 acres along 2 mile stretch of its facilities, with offsite mitigation for riparian habitat impacts proposed at the Cock Robin Island Unit of the Eel River Wildlife Area, 4 miles west of Loleta, Humboldt County. (TLG-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0446 (Caltrans District 1, Elk)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Transportation to demolish and replace existing two-lane Highway 1 bridge over Elk Creek with new, wider, two-lane bridge with standard bridge railings and shoulders, separated bicycle and pedestrian path, and other roadway and bridge improvements and replace existing rock slope protection with a root wad bank support revetment, located approximately 2.5 miles south of the unincorporated town of Elk, Mendocino County. (AL-A)

(CB-SD)

item_title: Items W17a & W18d, below will share a combined staff report and hearing

subitem_title: Notice of Impending Development No. NCC-NOID-0002-22 (Caltrans Interstate 5 Improvements Stage 4C, Encinitas and Carlsbad).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on NOID by California Department of Transportation, pursuant to NCC PWP/TREP, to repair eroded northern embankment of Interstate-5 at Agua Hedionda Lagoon with fill and rock slope protection covering two acres; placement of excess fill at the Poinsettia Avenue-Interstate-5 freeway gore site; bridge rail replacements at Agua Hedionda and Buena Vista Lagoons; southbound shoulder and slope repair between Carlsbad Village Drive and Chestnut Avenue;  sound wall installation near Chinquapin Avenue; and ADA curb ramps at various locations within the cities of Encinitas and Carlsbad, San Diego County. (ME-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

(CB-SD) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.) No changes are proposed to t 3-ft. x 24-ft. gangway or 162 sq.ft. pier.  Two 14 in. concrete guide piles will remain and be reused in place, located at 203 Via Lido Nord, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0204 (Cook, Newport Beach)

One 12 in. concrete guide pile will remain and be reused in place. Another 12 in. concrete guide pile will be removed and replaced with new 12 in. concrete guide pile in different location, at 3312 Marcus Avenue, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

(CS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0060 (LA21G, LLC (dba Thomas James Homes), Newport Beach)

Height of bulkhead with proposed new stem wall will be 10.9 feet NAVD88/11.1 feet MLLW; at 4014 Channel Place, Newport Beach, Orange County. (MV–LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0311 (Norton, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Sean and Emily Norton to construct 30-ft. long, 3-ft. tall cinder block with smooth stucco finish patio perimeter wall 15 ft. from south (ocean-facing) property line to enclose 15-ft. deep x 30-ft. wide, 450 sq.ft. sandy beach area for private patio use associated with single-family home within City of Newport Beach permitted beach encroachment area, at 6806 W. Oceanfront, Newport Beach, Orange County. (LR–LB)

(LR–LB)

(AS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0742 (Ashabi, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Allen and Pari Ashabi to remodel two, single-story, 18-ft. tall buildings housing 2 rental units each with combined living area of 3,064 sq.ft. separated by breezeway and covered by single roof and 570 sq.ft. addition to Unit #3 within breezeway combining the two structures into one single 3,645 sq.ft. 4-Unit structure; demolish and reconstruct 4-car garage and new permeable paver driveway, no new landscaping or changes to site drainage on 16,323 sq.ft. oceanfront bluff top lot at 1011 Buena Vista, San Clemente, Orange County. (LR–LB)

item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL
General Public Comment will not be held due to the Local Government Workshop.

item_blurb: Public hearing on joint workshop with the League of Cities, California State Association of Counties, local government officials and the California Coastal Commission to discuss sea level rise adaptation and Local Coastal Program (LCP) Updates. (JA/MC-SF)

item_title: NOTE: For the workshop, there will be no more than one (1) hour for public comment. Due to the significant level of interest in this item and the limited time available, speakers' time will be limited to 1 to 2 minutes, depending on the number of speakers, and at the discretion of the Commission Chair. Speakers will be limited to verbal comments only (no presentations, recorded videos, etc.). We urge written comments or other materials be submitted to: statewideplanning@coastal.ca.gov)
